intro: Hypoporum tenellum, commonly known as the slender hypoporum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
